Collection: toolkit

The toolkit collection is positioned as a set of profiles/agents for building sophisticated CLI tools using repeatable “recipes” and structured approaches.

What you get

  • A ready-to-use profile (commonly referenced as toolkit-dev)
  • Agents you can invoke by name (often prefixed like toolkit:...)
  • Domain context and workflow scaffolding for tool-building

How it tends to be used

  • Authoring new tools/modules for Amplifier
  • Creating multi-step CLI workflows with explicit “inputs/outputs” and repeatable structure
  • Turning ad-hoc prompts into reusable procedures

Tradeoffs

  • More structure than a general-purpose dev profile (great when you want it; heavy when you don’t)
  • May bring in additional modules and conventions that you’ll want to learn

Install and try

amplifier collection add git+https://github.com/microsoft/amplifier-collection-toolkit@main
amplifier profile use toolkit-dev
